DataElement.preferredName: Weighted T1 Magnetic Resonance Imaging Other Category Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Description of the T1-Weighted MRI 'other' category to describe images that are weighted according to the so-called spin-lattice relaxation time (T1) of the protons that give rise to the MRI signals.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Short Transverse Spin Relaxation Rate Time
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Having little (physical) length or seeming to be limited in (temporal) duration._The relaxation rate of spin polarization in the plane perpendicular to the magnetic field of a spectrometer back to zero as precessing spins loose coherence with each other._the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having little (physical) length or seeming to be limited in (temporal) duration.:The relaxation rate of spin polarization in the plane perpendicular to the magnetic field of a spectrometer back to zero as precessing spins loose coherence with each other.

Concepts.definition: Having little (physical) length or seeming to be limited in (temporal) duration.
The relaxation rate of spin polarization in the plane perpendicular to the magnetic field of a spectrometer back to zero as precessing spins loose coherence with each other.

Property.preferredDefinition: Time is the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.  It may also refer to a specific point in this continuum or to the interval separating two points.  It is generally measured in minutes, days, months, or years.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ValueDomain.preferredName: Weighted T1 Magnetic Resonance Imaging Other Category Text
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Description of the T1-Weighted MRI 'other' category to describe images that are weighted according to the so-called spin-lattice relaxation time (T1) of the protons that give rise to the MRI signals.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Weight Time Integer::1 Magnetic Resonance Imaging Other Category Text
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.:the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.:A number with no fractional part.::1:Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders. :Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:Category; used informally to mean a class of things.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.

Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support MGH Imaging trial
